acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Not classified from 96 hours LC50>100mg/L of the fish (Oryzias Latipest) (MOE eco-toxicity tests of chemicals (1997) and others.).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the guinea pig LC50 value of 1,500ppm, calculated from the testing data of guinea pig LC50 (4 hour inhalation of vapour) of 11mg/L (CERI Hazard Data 2001-64 (2002)), exceeded the saturated vapour concentration (140ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 0.014kPa (25degC) (HSDB (2006)), the substance was considered as "mist exposure," and  the obtained LC50 was lower than the upper limit value of Category 4 (5mg/L) by more than 2.5 fold.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) of 4,696mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 2001-64 (2002)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since it was not water-insolubility (the water-solubility =11300mg/L (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), and acute toxicity was low, it was classified into Not classified.

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is 76degC (Dean (15th, 1999)), which is classified into "Category 4."

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to the insufficiency of data (no data available on in vivo mutagenicity/genotoxicity tests)

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: May damage fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on the evidence of decreased delivery in the absence of toxic effects on females, described in Report by the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (1998) and CERI Hazard Data 2001-64 (2002).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though containing unsaturated bonds (olefin)

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests: "Severe conjunctival irritation was noted" (though no data are available on reversibility). Classified as Category 1 in accordance with the technical guideline, given the fact that the substance is classified into Category 1A-1C for "2. Skin corrosion/irritation."

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on guinea pig skin irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 2001-64 (2002)): "Severe irritation was observed" (though study details are not available). Although classified into Category 1A-1C in the absence of data on reversibility, the substance should be placed in Category 1A from the viewpoint of safety if further subclassification is needed.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
